text.text:
Food is delicious and prepared well.
Great ambience during off peak hours too.
Beautiful deco.

Ingredients is very fresh and portion is generous.

However the service staff needs to be trained.

As friend and I are seating opposite each other, there is left little space to put the big tray of dishes. There is no move grounds for me to move back, and young waitress still tactless squeeze the tray bet the limited space and my body.

Quite unpleasant considering that there is hot dish on the tray and the tray is fully laid.

If the table doesn't fit the tray, put the food aside first and help to arrange it, or be slow in putting down the tray instead of 'hitting' the customer with the tray.

And when there are many tables, pls do not sit the customers so closely tog esp when it is off peak.

Tea served is not hot. If tea is pre-prepared and is not hot alr, do serve another hot pot of tea. For a good restaurant, tea should be pipping hot.

Service really inadequate.

Contrast from the orchard branch.

text.text: Had early dinner here. Initially there were 2 other tables and then I had the whole venue for myself cos it was really at an odd hour. Ordered their Pork Tamago Kamameshi which includes the main kettle rice of course, and sides like Karaage, pork soup, and hot drink. So satisfied with the meal, especially the pork belly. It’s so soft that it really melts in the mouth.

originalText.text: Had early dinner here. Initially there were 2 other tables and then I had the whole venue for myself cos it was really at an odd hour. Ordered their Pork Tamago Kamameshi which includes the main kettle rice of course, and sides like Karaage, pork soup, and hot drink. So satisfied with the meal, especially the pork belly. It’s so soft that it really melts in the mouth.

text.text:
There is a 90 mins limit for dine in. But the atmosphere is pretty unbearable, as there is no aircon or minimal. It was so hot, me and my mum quickly finish the hot food and left.
Food quality was not of standard. Such as the udon was mushy. The octopus for the spring collection was tough and hard to chew. And the rice was pretty hard to chew as well. And as for one of the side dishes, the cheese mochi, it seems hastily prepared, as there were specks of white salt thrown on the dish before two of the mini mochi were placed on it. I am puzzled by this, as the cheese mochi is slightly salty and why would there be more salt being placed? And in most quality japanese restaurants the condiments would at least be placed on the side or not at all to not disturb the original taste of the food. I looked through the other reviews and I saw the exact cheese mochi dish, and the salt was not present. Thus, this leads me to believe it was of carelessness or unintention by the chef and was overlooked before serving.

The good part is the service is good and fast.

text.text:
The taste of food is like normal local frozen food from supermarket does not seem to be
Prep. by Japanese chef. Actually not quite worth to eat here. 2 of us dine amounted to $90+. If by Japanese chef this will be worth.will not recommend this restaurant. Rather disappointed.
